title: I'm a little disappointed in the Warlord/Fervor changes
body:
From 2/14 Update http://www.surrenderat20.net/2017/02/214-pbe-update.html

- Fervor of Battle (Ferocity Tier 6)
Stacks of Fervor duration increased from 6 seconds to 8 seconds.

- Warlord's Bloodlust (Ferocity Tier 6)
Life steal against champions based on missing health lowered from 20% to 15%.

The way it was mentioned, I thought the changes would be a little more.. impactful? I'm not really sure what I thought was going to happen; the extra duration on Fervor is certainly nice, but I don't feel like this addresses how these two keystones just sort of swap between being strictly better than the other for ADCs.

What do you guys think?

replies.body:
Warlord's could be more engaging, interactive, cooler. We'd like to look into options for it at some point, though can't make any definite promises there.

In the short term though we believe the game's just straight better without Warlord's being a common choice in lane. That much sustain from game start results in some trends that lead to less interesting game states (poke doesn't stick so burst or farm strats get favored, some champs go warlords to avoid losing lane at the expense of mid game+ effectiveness against other positions, comparative impact of lifesteal items gets devalued etc).

There are a few reasons I'm taking Warlords over fervor:
1. Enemy supports can typically 100-0 solo me with the meta of Zyra/Brand/Malz/MF. Without that sustain, the enemy support just forces me out anytime their is combo up.
2. The extra LS is nice against assassins since the meta supports aren't that peel based like a Janna so I need that to survive the assassin meta.
3. Trades with ADCs right now are typically only a couple of AAs, supports tend to do a lot of the trading. I get more value from 1 AA onto an enemy ADC with Warlords than I do with 1 auto with fervor. If I do try to go for an extended trade, I'll just have 6 voidlings on me or 3 Zyra plants AAiing outside of my AA range.

I really don't see much reason to go fervor until supports like Braum/Alistar/Trundle come back into the meta where I'm losing lane because of budget midlaners that dictate botlane.

If Fervor of Battle has become "necessary" for marksmen to have a decent mid game, then where is the player choice? Keystones are supposed to be impactful but varied. At this point you've nerfed champions and items based on how they function when a champion pairs them with Fervor. Then you nerfed Fervor and everything went to hell.

Introducing base damage to champions' kits doesn't go well. I thought Riot learned its lesson when it had to buff several champions just to change Lich Bane, but then we got Ludens Echo and now this mess...

As an adc main in this meta, warlord is what keeps me alive through the horrendous early and mid game. If you nerf warlord just to make this more engaging, then we can delete half the marksman champs and all play poke mages instead.
At the same time though, with poke supports effectively dominating the bot lane...

Ever considered making Warlords a "Surge" or "lifeline" type effect where you it would only last until you leave combat?

Seems that would be the easiest way to solve the interaction and the poke-counter problems that the keystone yields.
Windows of power and whatnot .

More windowed versions (with a CD, only does anything below X% health etc) have shown some promise. We'll likely keep testing those sort of things, not confident enough we'll ship something to make any promises though.

I'm really not sure "Coolness" should be taken into account when something is being made or balanced. 
I mean it'd be cool if Nami's ult was global and twice the size.
It would feel like an actual Tidal Wave, but I'm not too sure it'd be healthy or smart for it to be like that. 
Imo how cool something is should only be visual,  and should not impact the actual balance of the game.

Speaking of engaging and interactive, Deathfire Touch is absolutely not, either. It'd be great to see that one getting changes like the ones Warlord's might. 

Also, any update to the new tech that would change how Thunderlord's works?

Why not just rework one of the two keystones to work differently than the other? Masteries from the other trees have different activation requirements (land cc, consecutive spells, stay in combat for set amount of time, deal % of target's health, etc); wouldn't Warlords and Fervor stop competing with one-another if they were designed to suit different playstyles? Being AA-centric means these two keystones have always been in a tug-of-war for being ''the best'' on ADCs. 

Either that, or change the effect completely; it's crazy that the best sustain option for keystones is in the Ferocity tree.
